newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps mostly steady, fuel edges higher.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps mostly steady, fuel edges higher.

text.p: European oil swaps were broadly steady on Wednesday. Brent CFDs eased off a touch after Tuesday's big hike while fuel edged up 75 cents to $1.

Brent CFDs were a few cents lower with dealers saying some of the steam had been taken out of the market with screen crude easing back. The market was fairly busy, but several of the trades were p+c as a trader went about liquidating its position.
July 2-4 was pegged at -3/+1 cents against August Brent, July 7-11 at -3 cents and July 14-18 at -9/10 cents.
July 7-11 traded at -5 cents against August twice and once at -13 cents against September. The month of September also traded at -30 cents.
July 14-18 traded at -19 cents against September and July 21-25 went at -23 cents against September.

Heavy fuel swaps gained up to 75 cents or so with July valued at $85, August between $85.50/$86 and September at about $87.25. Low sulphur swaps were up by a similar amount and August was heard traded at $94.75.
Naphtha swaps held fairly steady after the $3 jump on Tuesday with July holding around $177, August $2.50 in contango and September in contango by a further $1.50.
